Using this card, generally speaking, would you say that most
people can be trusted, or that you can't be too careful in dealing with people?

Later on I will ask you about how democracy is working in Ireland.
First, however, I want you to think instead about how important you think different things are for democracy in general.
There are no right or wrong answers so please just tell me what you think.
Using this card, please tell me how important you think it is for democracy in general...
...that national elections are free and fair?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
...that voters discuss politics with people they know before deciding how to vote?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
...that different political parties offer clear alternatives to one another?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
...that opposition parties are free to criticise the government?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
that the media are free to criticise the government?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
And still thinking generally rather than about Ireland, how important do you think it is for democracy in general...
...that the media provide citizens with reliable information to judge the government?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
...that the rights of minority groups are protected?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
...that citizens have the final say on the most important political issues by voting on them directly in referendums?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
that immigrants only get the right to vote in national elections once they become citizens?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
...that the courts treat everyone the same?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
...that the courts are able to stop the government acting beyond its authority?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
And still thinking generally rather than about Ireland, how important do you think it is for democracy in general...
...that governing parties are punished in elections when they have done a bad job?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
...that the government protects all citizens against poverty?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
...that the government explains its decisions to voters?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
...that the government takes measures to reduce differences in income levels?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
...that politicians take into account the views of other European governments before making decisions?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
Now some questions about the same topics, but this time about how you think democracy is working in Ireland today.
Again, there are no right or wrong answers, so please just tell me what you think.
Using this card, please tell me to what extent you think each of the following statements applies in Ireland.
0 means you think the statement does not apply at all and 10 means you think it applies completely.
READ OUT EACH STATEMENT AND CODE IN THE GRID.
National elections in Ireland are free and fair.
Voters in Ireland discuss politics with people they know before deciding how to vote
Different political parties in Ireland offer clear alternatives to one another.
Opposition parties in Ireland are free to criticise the government.
The media in Ireland are free to criticise the government.
Using the same card please tell me to what extent you think each of these statements applies in Ireland.
READ OUT EACH STATEMENT AND CODE IN THE GRID.
The media in Ireland provide citizens with reliable information to judge the government.
The rights of minority groups in Ireland are protected.
Citizens in Ireland have the final say on the most important political issues by voting on them directly in referendums.
The courts in Ireland treat everyone the same.
And using the same card please tell me to what extent you think each of these statements applies in Ireland.
READ OUT EACH STATEMENT AND CODE IN THE GRID.
Governing parties in Ireland are punished in elections when they have done a bad job.
The government in Ireland protects all citizens against poverty
The government in Ireland explains its decisions to voters.
The government in Ireland takes measures to reduce differences in income levels.
And to what extent does this statement apply in Ireland?
Politicians in Ireland take into account the views of other European governments before making decisions.
At the next questions, I'll first ask you to choose between two options.
Then I'll ask how important you think your choice is for democracy in general.
Finally, I'll ask you to think about this issue in Ireland today.
Remember, there are no right or wrong answers, so please just tell me what you think.
There are differing opinions on whether or not everyone should be free to express their political views openly in a democracy, even if they are extreme.
Which one of the statements on this card describes what you think is best for democracy in general?
Everyone should be free to express their political views openly, even if they are extreme
Those who hold extreme political views should be prevented from expressing them openly
How important do you think it is for democracy in general that everyone is free to express their political views openly, even if they are extreme?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
Using this card, to what extent do you think everyone in Ireland today is free to express their political views openly, even if they are extreme?
How important do you think it is for democracy in general that those who hold extreme political views are prevented from expressing them openly?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
Using this card, to what extent do you think those who hold extreme political views in Ireland today are prevented from expressing them openly?
Sometimes the government disagrees with what most people think
Which one of the statements on this card describes what you think is best for democracy in general?
The government should change its planned policies in response to what most people think
The government should stick to its planned policies regardless of what most people think
How important do you think it is for democracy in general that the government changes its planned policies in response to what most people think?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
Using this card, please tell me how often you think the government in Ireland today changes its planned policies in response to what most people think?
How important do you think it is for democracy in general that the government sticks to its planned policies regardless of what most people think?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
Using this card, please tell me how often you think the government in Ireland today sticks to its planned policies regardless of what most people think?
The government in some countries is formed by a single party; in other countries by two or more parties in coalition.
Which option on this card describes what you think is best for democracy in general?
A single party forms the government
Two or more parties in coalition form the governmen
How important do you think it is for democracy in general that the government is formed by a single party?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
Now for the last question on this topic.
Using this card, please tell me how often you think the government in Ireland is formed by a single party?
How important do you think it is for democracy in general that the government is formed by two or more parties in coalition?
Not at all important for democracy in general
Extremely important for democracy in general
Now for the last question on this topic.
Using this card, please tell me how often you think the government in Ireland is formed by two or more parties in coalition?
